About Me

Bridging Technology, Research, and Human Care.

Innovating Healthcare Through Immersive Technology

Hello! I'm Reza Darooei, an FCS Postdoctoral Research Fellow in Software Engineering at the University of Bern, supported by the Swiss Government Excellence Scholarship. I hold a Ph.D. in Biomedical Engineering, where my thesis focused on OCT cyst segmentation using deep learning and sparse representations, and an MSc focused on asthma diagnosis based on sparse basis and breathing patterns.

My current research develops VR-based blended learning solutions to enhance physician-patient communication, particularly for managing frightened children in critical settings. I believe that integrating empathy, rigorous science, and immersive technology transforms healthcare education and outcomes.

Previously, I worked as a Regulatory Affairs Specialist at Iran's FDA, overseeing medical device and AI compliance. Alongside academia, I mentor startups and freelancers, supporting them in prototype development, market research, and strategic business modelling.

My technical toolkit includes Python, MATLAB, C++, C#, JavaScript, Unreal Engine, Unity, and advanced game development tools like Daz3D, iClone, and Maya. I thrive on building intelligent, interactive systems that bridge data science, immersive technology, and real-world impact.
